text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Aviation fuel" means:
aviation gasoline; or
turbine fuel.

"Aviation gasoline" means gasoline that:
meets the aviation gasoline standards of specification D-910 of the American Society for Testing and Materials, as amended from time to time; and
is used to propel gasoline-powered aircraft.

section.section:
"Gasoline" means a product that:
is used as fuel in a spark ignited, internal combustion engine; or
is designated as gasoline by the Comptroller.

text.section:
"Motor fuel" means:
gasoline; or
special fuel.

"Motor vehicle" means a vehicle that:
is self-propelled;
is designed to be operated on a public highway; and
is not operated only on rails.

section.section: "Special fuel" means a product that is usable as fuel in an internal combustion engine.
"Special fuel" includes clean-burning fuel except electricity.

text.section: "Turbine fuel" means Jet A, A-1, or B fuel that is used to propel turbine powered aircraft.
